revised_title: The Effects of Acute Cestode Tuberculosis in Cattle
tldr: The authors conducted an experiment to study the effects of administering proglottides of Tania mediocanellata to a calf. They observed symptoms of nervous irritability, loss of appetite, and muscle tremors. Post-mortem examination revealed cysticercus vesicles in the calf's muscles, confirming the presence of acute cestode tuberculosis. This study highlights the potential dangers of this parasitic infection in cattle.
